channel.title: Whonix at opencollective?
channel.description:
https://opencollective.com
Seems cool at first view. Let's sign Whonix up?
@Ego:
* I invited you to [Whonix github organization](https://github.com/orgs/Whonix/people). You should have received an e-mail. Please accept. * Please send a pull request for https://github.com/Whonix/Whonix/blob/master/README.mediawiki. Add a link to https://github.com/Whonix/EgoBits1.github.io. This is required so you register under github.com/Whonix/Whonix. (Says opencollective `You need to select at least two contributors`. (And more than 100 github stars, that we have.)

item.title: Whonix at opencollective?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Actually, it doesn’t do what I thought it does. I thought it’s a general fund which people can donate to which then is distributed to all participating projects. But actually we’d have to redirect donors to opencollective, have them take the 10% fee, then get the money out. Not useful at this stage where all payment methods and bureaucracy is already worked out.

Read full topic
